5/5 Excellent
Emma
Traveled with group
Dec 6, 2019
Liked: Cleanliness, staff & service, amenities, property conditions & facilities
The location of this hotel is fab! You are pretty much withing walking distance of all the tourist attractions. Not to mention you'll have an amazing view of Empire State Building (check out the roof top bar for the best pics!). If you ask for a Sky view room or City view room, you'll get those advertised rooms with the great views. The security in the hotel is great as you can't get anywhere without your hotel room key. The room was compact but pleasantly roomier than I think some people give it credit for. The shower and toilet are together behind a frosted glass wall so you will have to come out from the frosted sliding door to wash your hands after going to the bathroom. The room has USB plug sockets which is great for charging phones without the need of a US converter plug! They also provided a powerful hairdryer (yes, powerful enough for even frizzy hair!) and a steamer for those not wanting to wear suitcase creases.. Bed is really comfortable, as are the towels provided (another bonus and saving on luggage weight). There's a coffee shop just in the lobby to start the day the right way and free umbrellas to use for those blustery rainy New York days. On our last day, we checked out early and left our bags at the hotel to continue adventuring until we had to leave for JFK airport, which is about a 40 minute yellow cab away, and the hotel called the cab for us to make everything effortless. Would i stay again? In a heartbeat!

Liked: Cleanliness, staff & service
Disliked: Property conditions & facilities, room comfort
Definitely not a 4 star hotel
Although this hotel gets great reviews, I would consider staying elsewhere. It's definitely not comparable to a 4 star hotel standard. I'll start with the positives: The best thing about the Arlo Nomad are the views from the rooftop terrace and the sky rooms. I suspect that those who book one of the other rooms would not have good views. The rooms were also very clean and the staff I interacted with were nice. The finishings in the hotel room are poor at best. It's as if they put minimal effort and money into designing and furnishing the rooms. To be honest, it reminded me of uni accommodations. The towels were the cheapest quality they are able to get away with, and the bed was far from comfortable. The only word to describe the bathroom is 'functional'. The whole hotel has a 'uni accommodation'/hostel vibe...definitely not something I look for in a hotel. I'm honestly confused about how this hotel managed to get a 4.6 rating, perhaps some of the reviews are fake? It isn't even close to a 4 star hotel (I'd say 3 star is a more accurate rating). There are far better hotels at a similar price point in Manhattan - don't be fooled by the photos on the site or the rating.

There is a cubby hole where we could put a small suitcase, but it was below clothes hangers, so we had to choose one or the other. There is a very large open cabinet above this, but guests would need a ladder to use it. There is NO private bath ROOM -- just an area, divided off by a smoked glass divider, open at the top. The bath sink bowl is very large (very design-y), but the edges are very narrow, no countertop for toiletries, so there is no safe place to put razors, toothpaste, brushes, etc. without them falling into the huge sink. There was no hot water in the sink. When taking a shower, the hot water only lasted a few minutes, then it got gradually cooler. I guess they are trying to be "green" by limiting the hot water? Very large bed, right next to the window and the wall, and only accessible from one side, so the person nearest the window must climb over the other person to get out of the bed.

The staff is great: I was immediately moved into a new room when the auto room shades of my first assigned room did not work.The restaurant staff was equally terrific and substituted without charge when I could not eat the highly (and unusually) spiced oatmeal. I would stay here again despite the small rooms, which many other hotels have but without the nice public spaces of this one. Another small criticism: the large floor to ceiling room shades did not not fit closely enough to really block out the street lights streaming into my room. This should be fixed, it might not bother everybody l but I need very dark room to sleep .
